p: The study found that the average cost of providing Option B+ services in the second year was higher compared to the first year. The finding could be attributed to the solitary additional cost incurred in the second year to perform the follow-up HIV DNA PCR. The follow-up HIV DNA PCR is done six weeks after an HIV-exposed infant ceases to breast feed [ 4], which commonly occurs in the second year of provision of Option B+ services to mother-baby pairs.
